calendar-event-select-committee.committee-name: East of England Regional Grand Committee
calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Priorities for a future Regional Strategy
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Oral questions to Minister Barbara Follett, chaired by Bob Russell MP for Colchester and David Amess MP

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: (i) Bank of England February 2010 Inflation Report (ii) Financial institutions - too important to fail?
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: (i) Mervyn King, Governor, Charles Bean, Deputy Governor, Spencer Dale, Executive Director and Chief Economist, Professor David Miles and Kate Barker, External Members of the Monetary Policy Committee, Bank of England (ii) Alfredo Sáenz, Vice Chairman and Chief Executive, Santander (at 10.45am)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Air Quality
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Jim Fitzpatrick MP, Minister of State, Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: The work of the Independent Police Complaints Commission
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Nick Hardwick, Chairman, Independent Police Complaints Commission and John Crawley

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: DFID’s Assistance to Zimbabwe
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Gareth Thomas MP, Minister of State, Department for Internation Development

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: The future of the nuclear industry in the North West
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Julie Maykels, North West Regional Manager, National Skills Academy for Nuclear, Professor Colin Boxall, University of Lancaster (on behalf of the North West Universities Association), Mike Graham, National Secretary, Prospect, and Rupert Steele, Director - Regulation, Scottish Power; Fergus McMorrow, Chief Executive, Copeland Borough Council, David Hayes, Energy Consultant, Cumbria Vision, and Richard Leafe, Chief Executive, Lake District National Park (at 3.15pm); Martin Forwood, Cumbrians Opposed to a Radioactive Environment, and Councillor Ralph Pryke, Nuclear Free Local Authorities England Forum (at 4.00pm)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: Housing in the South East
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: Partnership for Urban South Hampshire, Gravesham Borough Council, Oxford City Council; Home Builders Federation, People and Places and Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors (at 5.15pm); Campaign to Protect Rural England, South East Housing Coalition, South East Forum for Sustainability and South East Forum on Ageing (at 6.00pm)

calendar-event-select-committee.subject: (i) Electoral Commission (ii) Pre-legislative scrutiny of the Draft Civil Law Reform Bill
calendar-event-select-committee.witness: (i) Jenny Watson, Chair, Electoral Commission (ii) Association of Personal Injury Lawyers, and Association of British Insurers (at 5.15pm)
